name: chicagotribune
text:

name: chicagotribune
text:
Today in The Spin:
– First day back for many Illinois businesses
– Unrest in Minneapolis
– Lori Lightfoot's "coded" message for Donald Trump

Here are today’s top stories in Chicago politics, from @byldonovan: https://t.co/sJUxYRC6ke

name: chicagotribune
text: Friday marked the end of the statewide stay-at-home order in Illinois, as Gov. J.B. Pritzker loosened restrictions on a range of businesses and activities, and lifted a cap on the number of people who can gather for religious services. Here's a recap. https://t.co/5TEa7Ukvww

name: chicagotribune
text: Place an ad congratulating your grad! Give your grad a keepsake to remember by sharing a photo and personal message in the Chicago Tribune. https://t.co/CwhyWfLGkh

text: Chicago will experiment with shutting down blocks in some neighborhoods to expand outdoor dining space, starting with these 6 streets https://t.co/X7EYHoUvcS

text: Aurora Police Chief Kristen Ziman condemned the actions of the Minneapolis police officer charged with third-degree murder and manslaughter in the death of George Floyd, saying, “Resisting suffocation is not resisting arrest.” https://t.co/0mjC4xH5QA

text: Protests over the death of George Floyd are spreading across the U.S. Here are the latest updates from key cities. https://t.co/S2uzICnTR7

name: chicagotribune
text:
The days of casually hopping in a cab or Uber to the airport and jostling for space in the overhead bin are gone – for now. From the curb to the plane, each portion of the journey comes with new precautions.

Here's what to expect, from The New York Times: https://t.co/GIIFR2JuJi

name: chicagotribune
text: “When we are suffering pain and trauma at the killing of a black man in the street, to try to ... blow the dog whistle to his base. I’m a black woman ... and I feel an obligation to speak out when something as offensive as that is said by anyone.” https://t.co/3UxwAXmohT

name: chicagotribune
text: “Sometimes the weight of recurring tragedies brings me down, pulling me into that quiet, seething anger. I felt that anger coming back with the latest video-inflamed racial catastrophe, the death of George Floyd,” columnist @cptime writes. https://t.co/LVb2Anq7co

name: chicagotribune
text: More than 700 nurses at a Joliet hospital could soon walk off the job after they voted late Friday to authorize a strike https://t.co/njb1jlKAml

name: chicagotribune
text: Protesters march through Chicago, block highway on Friday evening: “We know how the process is going to play out. They exonerate these cops, and if they don’t exonerate them, they give them a slap on the wrist.” https://t.co/JyGLaLBi9J
